title: ONYX STORM
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The third book in the Empyrean series. As enemies gain traction, Violet Sorrengail goes beyond the Aretian wards in search of allies.

title: THE STRAWBERRY PATCH PANCAKE HOUSE
author: Laurie Gilmore
description: The fourth book in the Dream Harbor series. A woman with a spotty work history becomes the live-in nanny for the daughter of a single dad.

title: THE WRITER
author: James Patterson and J.D. Barker
description: An N.Y.P.D. detective is called to a crime scene in an apartment where the shelves are full of books by a true-crime writer.

title: FOURTH WING
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

title: THE HOUSEMAID
author: Freida McFadden
description: Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.

title: EVERYTHING IS TUBERCULOSIS
author: John Green
description: The author of “The Anthropocene Reviewed” chronicles the fight against the deadly infectious disease tuberculosis.

title: ABUNDANCE
author: Ezra Klein and Derek Thompson
description: A New York Times opinion columnist and a staff writer at The Atlantic evaluate obstacles to American progress.

title: CARELESS PEOPLE
author: Sarah Wynn-Williams
description: A former Facebook executive gives an account of policies and leadership at the social media platform.

title: RESOLUTE
author: Benjamin Hall
description: The author of “Saved” recounts his journey to recovery from the injuries he sustained from a Russian missile attack in Ukraine.

title: THE TELL
author: Amy Griffin
description: The founder of the investment firm G9 Ventures recounts her efforts to recover from trauma she experienced during childhood.

title: SHRED HAPPENS: SO EASY, SO GOOD
author: Arash Hashemi

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: REFUGEE
author: Alan Gratz
description: Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: THE CURSED CAMPGROUND
author: FGTeeV with Joe Caramagna. Illustrated Tim Wesson
description: Duddy inadvertently summons Bigfoot to the campground. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: OLD SCHOOL
author: Gordon Korman
description: Dexter, a 12-year-old raised and home-schooled by senior citizens, must now attend school with kids his own age. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: HOW TO CATCH THE EASTER BUNNY
author: Adam Wallace and Andy Elkerton
description: The Easter Bunny avoids traps in order to deliver eggs and candy. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: BUFFALO FLUFFALO
author: Bess Kalb. Illustrated Erin Kraan
description: A buffalo's posturing is exposed when the rain falls. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: WILL THE PIGEON GRADUATE?
author: Mo Willems
description: The Pigeon questions his academic future. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: THE GOOD EGG PRESENTS: THE GREAT EGGSCAPE!
author: Jory John. Illustrated Pete Oswald
description: Good Egg and his pals escape their carton! (Ages 4 to 8)

title: HOW TO CATCH A LEPRECHAUN
author: Adam Wallace. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: This is the year you'll finally catch a leprechaun. (Ages 4 to 10)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: written and illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE WILD ROBOT
author: Peter Brown
description: Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: PERCY JACKSON & THE OLYMPIANS
author: Rick Riordan
description: A boy battles mythological monsters. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: WINGS OF STARLIGHT
author: Allison Saft
description: Clarion, the successor to the throne of Pixie Hollow, is determined to confront a monster that threatens the land. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: REBEL WITCH
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: Rune and Gideon must join forces to stop a sinister plot by Cressida Roseblood. (Ages 13 to 18)

title: OUR INFINITE FATES
author: Laura Steven
description: Evelyn and Arden are doomed souls who repeatedly fall in love and kill each other. (Ages 13 to 18)

title: HEARTLESS HUNTER
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: Rune, a witch, and Gideon, a witch-hunter, fall in love. (Ages 13 to 18)

title: FABLE FOR THE END OF THE WORLD
author: Ava Reid
description: Inesa, the hunted, and Melinoë, the hunter, fall in love in a postapocalyptic society. (Ages 14 and up)
